txt.en: A Daring Plan

'It is true that I deceived you and your hobbit friend, but I did not truly wish for either of you to come to harm. The more I dwelled upon it, the more I realized I could not stand with my brothers in this. When their guard relaxed, I freed Bingo from his cage and we fled from Gabilazan. But in our haste, that poor hobbit did not pay close attention to his footing, and the ground gave way!

'Bingo fell down this hole, and I fear he fell beyond the reach of my voice, for he has not responded to my calls. I think I heard splashing from far below, but I cannot be certain. If he did survive, he will need supplies. If you return to Gabilazan and collect bundles of food and the bottles of water the dwarves carry, we can drop them down the hole after Bingo!

'Please trust me, [placeholder]! I will do all I can to make this right!'
Defeat Dourhands at the fortress of Gabilazan ([placeholder]/[placeholder])

'It is true that I deceived you and your hobbit friend, but I did not truly wish for either of you to come to harm. The more I dwelled upon it, the more I realized I could not stand with my brothers in this. When their guard relaxed, I freed Bingo from his cage and we fled from Gabilazan. But in our haste, that poor hobbit did not pay close attention to his footing, and the ground gave way!

'Bingo fell down this hole, and I fear he fell beyond the reach of my voice, for he has not responded to my calls. I think I heard splashing from far below, but I cannot be certain. If he did survive, he will need supplies. If you return to Gabilazan and collect bundles of food and the bottles of water the dwarves carry, we can drop them down the hole after Bingo! If he did survive, he will need any of the water and food we can provide to him.

'Please trust me, [placeholder]! I will do all I can to make this right!'
Search the slopes just north of Gabilazan for any sign of Bingo's escape

'The Dourhands have launched a number of attacks on my people from a stronghold in the High Crag. That place is called Gabilazan, and it seems to be their base of operations in this stretch of the Misty Mountains.\n\n'You defeated many Dourhands but did not find Bingo? You should return to Gabilazan and conduct a more effective search!'

'I have done some thinking, [placeholder], and I think I know where those Dourhand villains brought your friend Bingo. They have launched a number of attacks on my people from a stronghold in the High Crag. That place is called Gabilazan, and it seems to be the Dourhand base of operations in this stretch of the Misty Mountains.

'Go to Gabilazan and defeat the Dourhands there in order to learn where they are keeping Bingo Boffin!'

You wonder if this is the extent of Glóin's daring plan, and tell him so. He laughs heartily.

'What more could a plan offer than this, [placeholder]? The opportunity to fight villainous Dourhands is justification enough for any such plan, if you want the opinion of this dwarf!'
Collected water-bottles from Dourhands ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
'DNT - Blah!'
Talk to Spalvi Dourhand by the hole in the mountain
'DNT - Blah!'
Find the courtyard in the southern reaches of Gabilazan
'Bingo has somehow escaped captivity? That is wonderful news... but where is he?\n\n'You should search the slopes just to the north of Gabilazan for sign of the missing hobbit.'

'Wait! Hear me out, [placeholder]! I am not your enemy!

'It is true that I deceived you and your hobbit friend, but I did not truly wish for either of you to come to harm. The more I dwelled upon it, the more I realized I could not stand with my brothers in this. When their guard relaxed, I freed Bingo from his cage and we fled from Gabilazan. But in our haste, that poor hobbit did not pay close attention to his footing, and the ground gave way!

'Bingo fell down this hole, and I fear he fell beyond the reach of my voice, for he has not responded to my calls. I think I heard splashing from far below, but I cannot be certain. If he did survive, he will need supplies. If you return to Gabilazan and collect bundles of food and the bottles of water the dwarves carry, we can drop them down the hole after Bingo! If he did survive, he will need any of the water and food we can provide to him.

'Please trust me, [placeholder]! I will do all I can to make this right!'
'Well? Where is Bingo?'
If Bingo did survive the fall, these supplies should help.... if they don't land on him.
Collect bundles of food from Gabilazan ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
'DNT - Blah!'
DNT - Blah!
If Bingo did survive the fall, these supplies should help.... if they don't land on him.
'Drop those supplies down the hole, [placeholder]! If Bingo survived the fall, he will be glad to have them!'

Dourhands can be found in the fortress of Gabilazan, in the High Crag of the Misty Mountains.\n\nGlóin believes you can learn where the Dourhands are holding Bingo Boffin if you attack them at the fortress of Gabilazan.

Spalvi Dourhand has had a change of heart, and wishes to help you rescue Bingo.\n\nSpalvi helped free Bingo from Gabilazan, but the hobbit fell down a hole during the escape. The Dourhand now wants to help you save Bingo, and thinks you can retrieve bundles of food and bottles of water from Gabilazan that you can drop down the hole to Bingo, if the hobbit survived the fall.

'I feel really bad about this, [placeholder]. I swear to you that I will help you find your friend, wherever he has ended up on my account. I am certain he will be fine, and we will all laugh about this when it is done. I will do some thinking about our next step, but know that I will not abandon the search until we find him safe and sound. I will make this right!'

<rgb=#FF0000>Next week: 'An Author Absent' (Recommended Level: 46)</rgb>
You heard some shouting from the southern reaches of Gabilazan. Is that where Bingo is being held captive?

Spalvi Dourhand is standing next to a deep, dark hole just north of Gabilazan.\n\nYou have collected supplies for Bingo, and should drop them down the hole to him, in case the hobbit survived the fall.
'Wait! Hear me out!'
Bingo was being held in a cage in Gabilazan, but somehow he has managed to escape!\n\nYou should search the slopes north of Gabilazan for any sign of Bingo's escape.
Spalvi Dourhand is standing by the deep, dark hole just north of Gabilazan, in the Misty Mountains.
Spalvi Dourhand stands by a deep, dark hole in the mountain, just north of Gabilazan. What story does HE have to tell?
Spalvi Dourhand stands by a deep, dark hole in the side of the mountain
'You must be the one who freed our captive! Now you will die!'
Collected bundles of food ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Collect water-bottles from Dourhands in Gabilazan ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Drop the supplies from Gabilazan down the deep, dark hole
Defeated Dourhands at Gabilazan ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Talk to Spalvi Dourhand by the deep, dark hole
Drop the supplies from Gabilazan down the deep, dark hole

'The Dourhands have launched a number of attacks on my people from a stronghold in the High Crag. That place is called Gabilazan, and it seems to be their base of operations in this stretch of the Misty Mountains.\n\n'Go to Gabilazan and defeat the Dourhands there in order to learn where they are keeping Bingo Boffin!'
Glóin has an idea where the Dourhands may have taken Bingo, and thinks you should try to assault the fortress and rescue the hobbit.
Was Bingo being held in this cage? And where has he gone now?
